message_1: A construction company needs to schedule eight workers to complete a project within the shortest time possible. Worker 1 can complete the project in 4 days, worker 2 in 3 days, worker 3 in 6 days, worker 4 in 2 days, worker 5 in 8 days, worker 6 in 5 days, worker 7 in 7 days, and worker 8 in 9 days. Each worker can only work on the project for 1 day without any rest. What is the shortest amount of time needed to complete the project?
message_2:
To find the shortest amount of time needed to complete the project, we need to determine the combined work rate of the workers. We can do this by finding the work completed by each worker in one day and then adding them together.

Worker 1: 1/4 of the project per day
Worker 2: 1/3 of the project per day
Worker 3: 1/6 of the project per day
Worker 4: 1/2 of the project per day
Worker 5: 1/8 of the project per day
Worker 6: 1/5 of the project per day
Worker 7: 1/7 of the project per day
Worker 8: 1/9 of the project per day

Combined work rate = (1/4) + (1/3) + (1/6) + (1/2) + (1/8) + (1/5) + (1/7) + (1/9)
To add these fractions, we need a common denominator. The least common multiple of the denominators (4, 3, 6, 2, 8, 5, 7, 9) is 504.

Combined work rate = (126/504) + (168/504) + (84/504) + (252/504) + (63/504) + (100/504) + (72/504) + (56/504)
Combined work rate = (126 + 168 + 84 + 252 + 63 + 100 + 72 + 56) / 504
Combined work rate = 921/504 of the project per day

Now, we need to find how many days it takes for the workers to complete the project together. To do this, we divide 1 (the whole project) by the combined work rate:

Days to complete the project = 1 / (921/504)
Days to complete the project = 504/921

Since workers can only work for whole days, we need to round up to the nearest whole number:

Days to complete the project = ceil(504/921) = 1 day

Therefore, the shortest amount of time needed to complete the project is 1 day.
